headline: Bitcoin rebounds, ETFs take hit, BofA recommends crypto: 3 Things
summary: US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) are rising in Tuesday's pre-market trading as bitcoin (BTC-USD) bounces back above $87,000 per token. As bitcoin's recent volatility has dragged crypto stocks lower, particularly hitting Strategy's (MSTR) ETFs in 2025. Bank of America (BAC) is recommending that its wealth management clients should have 4% of their portfolio allocated into crypto. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Bank of America Backs 4% Crypto Allocation as Retail Takes Losses
summary: Bank of America now recommends a 1–4% crypto allocation for clients, even as retail investors absorb major ETF losses amid market volatility.

raw.headline: Bank of America Backs 4% Crypto Allocation as Retail Takes Losses

headline: Here are the 5 bullish themes for small caps in the year ahead, according to BofA
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America analysts told investors in a note Tuesday that small caps are positioned for a “big recovery” in 2026, arguing that five bullish forces are setting the stage for outperformance after a difficult start to 2025.

headline: Oppenheimer has a Positive Outlook on Bank of America (BAC)
summary: Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) is one of the best dividend stocks to buy according to hedge funds. On November 19, Chris Kotowski, an Oppenheimer analyst, reiterated a Buy recommendation on BAC. The price target was set at $55. headline: Barclays Analyst Bullish on Bank of America (BAC)
summary: Bank of America Corporation (NYSE:BAC) is one of the best dividend stocks in the financial sector. On November 17, Barclays analyst Jason Goldberg maintained a Buy recommendation on Bank of America stock, with a $59 price target. In a separate company announcement, dated November 13, Bank of America shared that it is debuting 401k Pay, […]

headline: ValuEngine Weekly Market Summary And Commentary
summary: Market action during Thanksgiving week delivered a broad-based rebound across US equities. Nearly all ETFs in our coverage list finished higher. Large-cap ETFs QQQM & SPYM were up every day.
